page.title: 20A Day in Our Lives.
page.content: We are eleven years old and attend Hadleigh Junior School. Some of us came to school by car but most of us walked. Those who have passed their Cycling proficiency test are allowed to ride on their bikes. The morning bell rings at 8.55a.m. and we have lessons until Assembly at 10.25a.m. Then it's playtime and we rush out to eat our crisps and play'Bulldog' or to stand and chat.At lunch time we eat our school dinner or packed lunches in the hall.You should see the new curtains:they are bright red and white stripes!We raised the money to buy them by holding a'sponsored spell'.The whole school was re-painted last term: the smell was terrible but it looks bright and cheerful now.Our classroom has a yellow ceiling,pale beige walls and red radiators. In September we shall be starting at King John/Deanes.
